doc.repnme: Competition law : some guidelines for implementation
doc.abstracts: High costs, poor economic performance associated with most forms of government interventions, large fiscal deficits and pressures to downsize the pubic sector, have led several developing and former centrally planned economies towards more market-oriented policies. These economies have highly concentrated industries, large state-owned sectors and/or inefficient firms operate in small markets insulated by trade barriers. Competition law will help them by strengthening market forces. Not only will the law help to lower costs and prices and increase consumer welfare, but it will foster sound business discipline, culture, and ethics -especially as state monopolies are being privatized. This important in a world economy which is becoming more integrated, where countries can no longer protect their industries without loss of profitable opportunities and international competitiveness. The author offers a framework for the design and implementation of competition law.
